steps.title: Authenticate
steps.description: Get your API token by sending your credentials.
steps.notes: Save the token from the response - you'll need it for all subsequent requests.

steps.title: List all resources
steps.description: Retrieve a list of all users with the token.

steps.title: Create a new resource
steps.description: Add a new user to the system.

code.content:
curl -X POST https://api.example.com/users \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"name": "Alice", "email": "alice@example.com"}'

steps.notes: The API returns the created user with an ID.

steps.title: Update a resource
steps.description: Modify an existing user by ID.

code.content:
curl -X PATCH https://api.example.com/users/123 \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email": "newemail@example.com"}'

steps.title: Delete a resource
steps.description: Remove a user from the system.
steps.notes: A successful deletion returns a 204 No Content status.
